page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY FAWKHAM 2
page.content: A well known lovely Georgian manor dating back to l722 was the White House near Fawkham Green and Speedgate Farm. Lying in a fold of the Kentish hills is the old church of Fawkham built in ll00 to replace the old Saxon church.Built of rubble and wood in the mediaeval manner it is a beautiful church with an octangonal spirelet of l5th century and an ancient but solitary 400 year old bell.Also in the church there are some early l4th century stained glass windows-the west window and some monuments,tablets and brasses.It is a place of quiet beauty just two miles from the Rising Sun.Tales of a headless solitary horseman and a nun wandering at midnight down the grassy paths add to the folklore and atmosphere of deep lonely antiquity.
